recipe_name: Fish fingers with chive yoghurt dip
author: Gino D'Acampo
method: Heat a heavy bottomed saucepan, a third full of vegetable oil, until a breadcrumb sizzles in it. (CAUTION: hot oil can be dangerous! Do not leave unattended.) Place the flour in a large bowl and beat in the egg and salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste.  Add the carbonated water and whisk to create a batter the consistency of double cream. Dredge the sole pieces in flour then dip pieces into the batter to coat. Place in the hot oil and deep-fry for 2-3 minutes, until crisp and golden. Carefully remove using a slotted spoon and drain on kitchen towels.  To make the dip, mix the yoghurt with the chives and lime juice. Transfer to a serving bowl. Serve the fish fingers on a plate with the dip and lime wedges alongside.
ingredients: vegetable oil, for deep-frying,  1 lemon sole fillet, cut into strips,  110g/4oz plain flour,  1 free-range egg,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  splash of carbonated water ,  110g/4oz Greek yoghurt,  2 tbsp fresh chives, chopped,  squeeze of lime juice,  Â½ lime, cut into wedges
